message_1: Find the conformal mapping of the unit circle |z|<1 onto the region bounded by the line segments [-1,1] on the real axis and [0,i] on the imaginary axis.
message_2:
To find the conformal mapping of the unit circle |z| < 1 onto the region bounded by the line segments [-1, 1] on the real axis and [0, i] on the imaginary axis, we can use the following steps:

1. Map the unit circle to the upper half-plane using the MÃ¶bius transformation:
   w = (z - i)/(z + i)

2. Map the upper half-plane to the right half-plane using the transformation:
   u = w^2

3. Map the right half-plane to the desired region using the transformation:
   v = (u - 1)/2

The final conformal mapping is the composition of these three transformations:
v(z) = (((z - i)/(z + i))^2 - 1)/2

This mapping will map the unit circle |z| < 1 onto the region bounded by the line segments [-1, 1] on the real axis and [0, i] on the imaginary axis.
